meanings.definition: A distinctive uniform worn by a servant or official.
meanings.sent1: The servant proudly wore his livery to show he worked for the noble family.
meanings.sent2: The hotel staff all wore matching livery to look professional.
meanings.sent3: The livery of the butler made him look like a fancy penguin.
meanings.sent4: The livery of the security guards made them seem like knights protecting the castle.
meanings.sent5: The bright red livery of the doorman made him easily recognizable from afar.

meanings.definition: The identifying colors or design of a company or organization.
meanings.sent1: The company's livery featured a bold logo on a blue background.
meanings.sent2: The airline's livery on the planes made them easy to spot on the runway.
meanings.sent3: The livery of the delivery trucks made them look like giant moving rainbows.
meanings.sent4: The livery of the school buses was so bright that they could be seen from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The livery of the restaurant chain included a cheerful mascot on all their packaging.

meanings.definition: The feeding, stabling, and care of horses for pay.
meanings.sent1: The stable offered livery services for horse owners who needed a place to keep their animals.
meanings.sent2: The livery of the horses at the ranch was top-notch, ensuring they were always healthy and happy.
meanings.sent3: The livery of the horses at the farm was so good that they seemed to prance with joy.
meanings.sent4: The livery of the racehorses was so luxurious that they seemed like pampered celebrities.
meanings.sent5: The livery of the carriage horses was impeccable, making them the envy of all other stables.
